**Quarto Wizard** is a Visual Studio Code extension that helps you manage your [Quarto](https://quarto.org) projects.
Install Quarto extensions directly from the [Quarto Extensions](https://github.com/mcanouil/quarto-extensions) listing repository with just a few clicks.

## Features

Browse Extensions
: View and search through hundreds of available Quarto extensions.
Filter by type, author, or functionality.

One-Click Install
: Install selected extensions with a single click.
Quarto Wizard handles downloading and setup automatically.

Manage Extensions
: View, update, and remove installed extensions from the Explorer view.
Keep your extensions up to date effortlessly.

Use Templates
: Quick-start documents with pre-configured templates for papers, presentations, and more.

Use Brands
: Apply Quarto brand assets to your project from GitHub, URL, or local sources.

Insert Extension Snippets
: Use snippets shipped by installed extensions directly from the Explorer view.

## Quick Start

1. **Install** the extension from the [VS Code Marketplace](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=mcanouil.quarto-wizard).
2. **Open** a Quarto project in VS Code.
3. **Press** `Ctrl+Shift+P` (or `Cmd+Shift+P` on macOS) and type "Quarto Wizard".
4. **Browse** and install extensions!

## Installation

Install from the VS Code Marketplace:

::: {.panel-tabset}

### Visual Studio Code

```{.bash filename="Terminal"}
code --install-extension mcanouil.quarto-wizard
```

Via [VS Code Marketplace](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=mcanouil.quarto-wizard).

### Positron

```{.bash filename="Terminal"}
positron --install-extension mcanouil.quarto-wizard
```

Via [Open VSX](https://open-vsx.org/extension/mcanouil/quarto-wizard).

:::

Or search for "Quarto Wizard" in the Extensions view (`Ctrl+Shift+X`).

See the [Installation Guide](getting-started/installation.qmd) for more options.
